parameters.description:
Retry key.
Specifies the UUID in hexadecimal format (e.g., `123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174000`) generated by any method.
The retry key isn't generated by LINE. Each developer must generate their own retry key.
parameters.name: X-Line-Retry-Key

post.description: Link rich menu to multiple users
Unlink rich menus from multiple users

You can use this endpoint to batch control the rich menu linked to the users using the endpoint such as Link rich menu to user.
The following operations are available:

1. Replace a rich menu with another rich menu for all users linked to a specific rich menu
2. Unlink a rich menu for all users linked to a specific rich menu
3. Unlink a rich menu for all users linked the rich menu
Validate a request body of the Replace or unlink the linked rich menus in batches endpoint.

get.description: Get the status of Replace or unlink a linked rich menus in batches.

parameters.description: A request ID used to batch control the rich menu linked to the user. Each Messaging API request has a request ID.
parameters.name: requestId

post.description: Issue link token

parameters.description:
User ID for the LINE account to be linked.
Found in the `source` object of account link event objects. Do not use the LINE ID used in LINE.
parameters.name: userId

parameters.description:
The name of the audience(s) to return.
You can search for partial matches.
This is case-insensitive, meaning AUDIENCE and audience are considered identical.
If omitted, the name of the audience(s) will not be used as a search criterion.
parameters.name: description

parameters.description: The status of the audience(s) to return. If omitted, the status of the audience(s) will not be used as a search criterion.
parameters.name: status

parameters.description:
The number of audiences per page. Default: 20
Max: 40
parameters.name: size

parameters.description:
true (default): Get public audiences created in all channels linked to the same bot.
false: Get audiences created in the same channel.
parameters.name: includesExternalPublicGroups

parameters.description:
How the audience was created. If omitted, all audiences are included.

`OA_MANAGER`: Return only audiences created with LINE Official Account Manager (opens new window).
`MESSAGING_API`: Return only audiences created with Messaging API.
parameters.name: createRoute

TWO_AUDIENCES.summary: Example of when there are two audiences that match the specified filter

NO_AUDIENCE.summary: Example of when there is no audience that matches the specified filter

You can check the per-unit statistics of how users interact with

Name of aggregation unit specified when sending the message. Case-sensitive.

Start date of aggregation period.

Format: yyyyMMdd (e.g. 20210301)

parameters.description:
End date of aggregation period. The end date can be specified for up to 30 days later. For example, if the start date is 20210301, the latest end date is 20210331.

Time zone: UTC+9
parameters.name: to

post.description: This is the dummy endpoint to generate the model classes
The module channel admin calls the Detach API to detach the module channel from a LINE Official Account.

If the Standby Channel wants to take the initiative (Chat Control), it calls the Acquire Control API.
The channel that was previously an Active Channel will automatically switch to a Standby Channel.

parameters.description: The `userId`, `roomId`, or `groupId`
parameters.name: chatId

post.description: To return the initiative (Chat Control) of Active Channel to Primary Channel, call the Release Control API.

parameters.description: The `userId`, `roomId`, or `groupId`

active.description:
Webhook usage status. Send a webhook event from the LINE Platform to the webhook URL only if enabled.

`true`: Webhook usage is enabled.
`false`: Webhook usage is disabled.

endpoint.description: A webhook URL to be validated.

success.description: Result of the communication from the LINE platform to the webhook URL.

timestamp.description: Time of the event in milliseconds. Even in the case of a redelivered webhook, it represents the time the event occurred, not the time it was redelivered.

statusCode.description: The HTTP status code. If the webhook response isn't received, the status code is set to zero or a negative number.

status.description:
The preparation status. One of:

`processing`: Preparing to get content.
`succeeded`: Ready to get the content. You can get the content sent by users.
`failed`: Failed to prepare to get the content.

notificationDisabled.description:
`true`: The user doesnt receive a push notification when a message is sent.
`false`: The user receives a push notification when the message is sent (unless they have disabled push notifications in LINE and/or their device).
The default value is false.

quoteToken.description: Quote token of the message. Only included when a message object that can be specified as a quote target was sent as a push or reply message.

notificationDisabled.description:
`true`: The user doesnt receive a push notification when a message is sent.
`false`: The user receives a push notification when the message is sent (unless they have disabled push notifications in LINE and/or their device).
The default value is false.

customAggregationUnits.description:
List of aggregation unit name. Case-sensitive.
This functions can only be used by corporate users who have submitted the required applications.

NotificationDisabled.description:
`true`: The user doesnt receive a push notification when a message is sent.
`false`: The user receives a push notification when the message is sent (unless they have disabled push notifications in LINE and/or their device).
The default value is false.

to.description: Array of user IDs. Use userId values which are returned in webhook event objects. Do not use LINE IDs found on LINE.

notificationDisabled.description:
`true`: The user doesnt receive a push notification when a message is sent.
`false`: The user receives a push notification when the message is sent (unless they have disabled push notifications in LINE and/or their device).
The default value is false.

`true`: The user doesnt receive a push notification when a message is sent.
`false`: The user receives a push notification when the message is sent (unless they have disabled push notifications in LINE and/or their device).
The default value is false.

and.description: Create a new recipient object by taking the logical conjunction (AND) of the specified array of recipient objects.

or.description: Create a new recipient object by taking the logical disjunction (OR) of the specified array of recipient objects.

max.description:
The maximum number of narrowcast messages to send.
Use this parameter to limit the number of narrowcast messages sent.
The recipients will be chosen at random.

upToRemainingQuota.description:
If true, the message will be sent within the maximum number of deliverable messages. The default value is `false`.

Targets will be selected at random.

phase.description:
The current status. One of:

`waiting`: Messages are not yet ready to be sent. They are currently being filtered or processed in some way.
`sending`: Messages are currently being sent.
`succeeded`: Messages were sent successfully. This may not mean the messages were successfully received.
`failed`: Messages failed to be sent. Use the failedDescription property to find the cause of the failure.

successCount.description: The number of users who successfully received the message.

failureCount.description: The number of users who failed to send the message.

targetCount.description: The number of intended recipients of the message.

failedDescription.description: The reason the message failed to be sent. This is only included with a `phase` property value of `failed`.

errorCode.description:
Error summary. This is only included with a phase property value of failed.
One of:

`1`: An internal error occurred.
`2`: An error occurred because there weren't enough recipients.
`3`: A conflict error of requests occurs because a request that has already been accepted is retried.
`4`: An audience of less than 50 recipients is included as a condition of sending.

acceptedTime.description:
Narrowcast message request accepted time in milliseconds.

Format: ISO 8601 (e.g. 2020-12-03T10:15:30.121Z)
Timezone: UTC

completedTime.description:
Processing of narrowcast message request completion time in milliseconds. Returned when the phase property is succeeded or failed.

Format: ISO 8601 (e.g. 2020-12-03T10:15:30.121Z)
Timezone: UTC

notificationDisabled.description:
`true`: The user doesnt receive a push notification when a message is sent.
`false`: The user receives a push notification when the message is sent (unless they have disabled push notifications in LINE and/or their device).
The default value is false.

value.description: The target limit for sending messages in the current month. This property is returned when the `type` property has a value of `limited`.

QuotaType.description: One of the following values to indicate whether a target limit is set or not.

totalUsage.description: The number of sent messages in the current month

status.description:
Aggregation process status. One of:

`ready`: The number of messages can be obtained.
`unready`: We haven't finished calculating the number of sent messages for the specified in date. For example, this property is returned when the delivery date or a future date is specified. Calculation usually takes about a day.
`unavailable_for_privacy`: The total number of messages on the specified day is less than 20.
`out_of_service`: The specified date is earlier than the date on which we first started calculating sent messages (March 31, 2018).

success.description:
The number of messages delivered using the phone number on the date specified in `date`.
The response has this property only when the value of `status` is `ready`.

messages.description: Array of message objects to validate

numOfCustomAggregationUnits.description: Number of aggregation units used this month.

customAggregationUnits.description: An array of strings indicating the names of aggregation units used this month.

next.description:
A continuation token to get the next array of unit names.
Returned only when there are remaining aggregation units that weren't returned in customAggregationUnits in the original request.

pictureUrl.description: Profile image URL. `https` image URL. Not included in the response if the user doesn't have a profile image.

statusMessage.description: User's status message. Not included in the response if the user doesn't have a status message.

language.description: User's language, as a BCP 47 language tag. Not included in the response if the user hasn't yet consented to the LINE Privacy Policy.

userIds.description:
An array of strings indicating user IDs of users that have added the LINE Official Account as a friend.
Only users of LINE for iOS and LINE for Android are included in `userIds`.

next.description:
A continuation token to get the next array of user IDs.
Returned only when there are remaining user IDs that weren't returned in `userIds` in the original request.
The number of user IDs in the `userIds` element doesn't have to reach the maximum number specified by `limit` for the `next` property to be included in the response.

premiumId.description: Bot's premium ID. Not included in the response if the premium ID isn't set.

pictureUrl.description: Profile image URL. `https` image URL. Not included in the response if the bot doesn't have a profile image.

chatMode.description:
Chat settings set in the LINE Official Account Manager. One of:

`chat`: Chat is set to "On".
`bot`: Chat is set to "Off".

markAsReadMode.description:
Automatic read setting for messages. If the chat is set to "Off", auto is returned. If the chat is set to "On", manual is returned.

`auto`: Auto read setting is enabled.
`manual`: Auto read setting is disabled.

pictureUrl.description: Profile image URL. `https` image URL. Not included in the response if the user doesn't have a profile image.
Profile image URL. `https` image URL. Not included in the response if the user doesn't have a profile image.

memberIds.description: List of user IDs of members in the group chat. Only users of LINE for iOS and LINE for Android are included in `memberIds`.

next.description:
A continuation token to get the next array of user IDs of the members in the group chat.
Returned only when there are remaining user IDs that were not returned in `memberIds` in the original request.

pictureUrl.description: Group icon URL. Not included in the response if the user doesn't set a group profile icon.

count.description: The count of members in the group chat. The number returned excludes the LINE Official Account.
The count of members in the multi-person chat. The number returned excludes the LINE Official Account.

selected.description: `true` to display the rich menu by default. Otherwise, `false`.

name.description: Name of the rich menu. This value can be used to help manage your rich menus and is not displayed to users.

chatBarText.description: Text displayed in the chat bar

areas.description: Array of area objects which define the coordinates and size of tappable areas

x.description: Horizontal position relative to the top-left corner of the area.

y.description: Vertical position relative to the top-left corner of the area.

selected.description: `true` to display the rich menu by default. Otherwise, `false`.

name.description: Name of the rich menu. This value can be used to help manage your rich menus and is not displayed to users.

chatBarText.description: Text displayed in the chat bar

areas.description: Array of area objects which define the coordinates and size of tappable areas

richMenuAliasId.description: Rich menu alias ID, which can be any ID, unique for each channel.

richMenuId.description: The rich menu ID to be associated with the rich menu alias.
The rich menu ID associated with the rich menu alias.
The rich menu ID to be associated with the rich menu alias.

userIds.description: Array of user IDs. Found in the `source` object of webhook event objects. Do not use the LINE ID used in LINE.
Array of user IDs. Found in the `source` object of webhook event objects. Do not use the LINE ID used in LINE.

operations.description: Array of Rich menu operation object...

resumeRequestKey.description: Key for retry. Key value is a string matching the regular expression pattern

RichMenuBatchOperation.description: Rich menu operation object represents the batch operation to the rich menu linked to the user.

type.description: The type of operation to the rich menu linked to the user. One of link, unlink, or unlinkAll.

RichMenuBatchLinkOperation.description: Replace the rich menu with the rich menu specified in the `to` property for all users linked to the rich menu specified in the `from` property.

RichMenuBatchUnlinkOperation.description: Unlink the rich menu for all users linked to the rich menu specified in the `from` property.

RichMenuBatchUnlinkAllOperation.description: Unlink the rich menu from all users linked to the rich menu.

acceptedTime.description:
The accepted time in milliseconds of the request of batch control the rich menu.

Format: ISO 8601 (e.g. 2023-06-08T10:15:30.121Z)
Timezone: UTC

completedTime.description:
The completed time in milliseconds of rich menu batch control. Returned when the phase property is succeeded or failed.

Format: ISO 8601 (e.g. 2023-06-08T10:15:30.121Z)
Timezone: UTC

RichMenuBatchProgressPhase.description:
The current status. One of:

`ongoing`: Rich menu batch control is in progress.
`succeeded`: Rich menu batch control is complete.
`failed`: Rich menu batch control failed.
          This means that the rich menu for one or more users couldn't be controlled.
          There may also be users whose operations have been successfully completed.

linkToken.description:
Link token.
Link tokens are valid for 10 minutes and can only be used once.

to.description: Message destination. Specify a phone number that has been normalized to E.164 format and hashed with SHA256.

notificationDisabled.description:
`true`: The user doesnt receive a push notification when a message is sent.
`false`: The user receives a push notification when the message is sent (unless they have disabled push notifications in LINE and/or their device).
The default value is false.

messages.description: Destination of the message (A value obtained by hashing the telephone number, which is another value normalized to E.164 format, with SHA256).

notificationDisabled.description:
`true`: The user doesnt receive a push notification when a message is sent.
`false`: The user receives a push notification when the message is sent (unless they have disabled push notifications in LINE and/or their device).
The default value is false.

imageUrl.description: URL of the icon that is displayed at the beginning of the button

name.description: Display name. Certain words such as `LINE` may not be used.

iconUrl.description: URL of the image to display as an icon when sending a message

quoteToken.description: Quote token of the message you want to quote.

substitution.description: A mapping that specifies substitutions for parts enclosed in {} within the `text` field.

quoteToken.description: Quote token of the message you want to quote.

SubstitutionObject.description: An object that defines the replacement value for a placeholder in the text.

MentionSubstitutionObject.description: An object representing a mention substitution.

EmojiSubstitutionObject.description: An object representing a emoji substitution.

quoteToken.description: Quote token of the message you want to quote.

clipboardText.description:
Text that is copied to the clipboard.
Max character limit: 1000

TemplateImageAspectRatio.description:
Aspect ratio of the image. This is only for the `imageAspectRatio` in ButtonsTemplate.
Specify one of the following values:

`rectangle`: 1.51:1
`square`: 1:1

TemplateImageSize.description:
Size of the image.  This is only for the `imageSize` in ButtonsTemplate.
Specify one of the following values:

`cover`: The image fills the entire image area. Parts of the image that do not fit in the area are not displayed.
`contain`: The entire image is displayed in the image area. A background is displayed in the unused areas to the left and right of vertical images and in the areas above and below horizontal images.

FlexBoxBorderWidth.description:
Width of box border. This is only for `borderWidth` in FlexBox.
A value of none means that borders are not rendered; the other values are listed in order of increasing width.

FlexBoxCornerRadius.description:
Radius at the time of rounding the corners of the box. This is only for `cornerRadius` in FlexBox.
A value of none means that corners are not rounded; the other values are listed in order of increasing radius.

FlexBoxSpacing.description:
You can specify the minimum space between two components with the `spacing` property of the parent box component, in pixels or with a keyword.
FlexBoxSpacing just provides only keywords.

FlexMargin.description:
You can specify the minimum space before a child component with the `margin` property of the child component, in pixels or with a keyword.
FlexMargin just provides only keywords.

FlexBoxPadding.description:
Padding can be specified in pixels, percentage (to the parent box width) or with a keyword.
FlexBoxPadding just provides only keywords.

FlexImageSize.description:
You can set the width of an Flex image component with the `size` property, in pixels, as a percentage, or with a keyword.
FlexImageSize just provides only keywords.

FlexIconSize.description:
You can set the width of an Flex icon component with the `size` property, in pixels, as a percentage, or with a keyword.
FlexIconSize just provides only keywords.

FlexTextFontSize.description:
Font size in the `size` property of the Flex text component.
You can specify the size in pixels or with a keyword.
FlexTextFontSize just provides only keywords.

FlexSpanSize.description:
Font size in the `size` property of the Flex span component.
You can specify the size in pixels or with a keyword.
FlexSpanSize just provides only keywords.

FlexOffset.description:
You can specify the offset of a component with the `offset*` property, in pixels or with a keyword.
You can also specify the percentage to the box width for `offsetStart` and `offsetEnd` and to the box height for `offsetTop` and `offsetBottom`.
FlexOffset just provides only keywords.

url.description:
Image URL (Max character limit: 2000)
Protocol: HTTPS (TLS 1.2 or later)
Image format: JPEG or PNG
Maximum image size: 10241024 pixels
Maximum file size: 10 MB (300 KB when the animated property is true)

flex.description: The ratio of the width or height of this component within the parent box.

margin.description: The minimum amount of space to include before this component in its parent container.

position.description:
Reference for offsetTop, offsetBottom, offsetStart, and offsetEnd. Specify one of the following values:

`relative`: Use the previous box as reference.
`absolute`: Use the top left of parent element as reference. The default value is relative.

size.description: The maximum image width. This is md by default.

aspectRatio.description:
Aspect ratio of the image.
`{width}:{height}` format.
Specify the value of `{width}` and `{height}` in the range from `1` to `100000`.
However, you cannot set `{height}` to a value that is more than three times the value of `{width}`.
The default value is `1:1`.

aspectMode.description: The display style of the image if the aspect ratio of the image and that specified by the aspectRatio property do not match.

backgroundColor.description: Background color of the image. Use a hexadecimal color code.

animated.description:
When this is `true`, an animated image (APNG) plays.
You can specify a value of true up to 10 images in a single message.
You can't send messages that exceed this limit.
This is `false` by default.
Animated images larger than 300 KB aren't played back.

clipboardText.description:
Text that is copied to the clipboard.
Max character limit: 1000

SubscribedMembershipPlan.description: Object containing information about the membership plan.

SubscribedMembershipUser.description: Object containing user membership subscription information.

membershipNo.description: The user's member number in the membership plan.

joinedTime.description: UNIX timestamp at which the user subscribed to the membership.

nextBillingDate.description:
Next payment date for membership plan.
- Format: yyyy-MM-dd (e.g. 2024-02-08)
- Timezone: UTC+9

totalSubscriptionMonths.description: The period of time in months that the user has been subscribed to a membership plan. If a user previously canceled and then re-subscribed to the same membership plan, only the period after the re-subscription will be counted.

memberCount.description: Number of members subscribed to the membership plan.

memberLimit.description: The upper limit of members who can subscribe. If no upper limit is set, it will be null.

isInAppPurchase.description: Payment method for users who subscribe to a membership plan.

chatId.description: User ID of the target user for whom the loading animation is to be displayed.

loadingSeconds.description:
The number of seconds to display the loading indicator.
It must be a multiple of 5. The maximum value is 60 seconds.

message.description: Message containing information about the error.

details.description: An array of error details. If the array is empty, this property will not be included in the response.

message.description: Details of the error. Not included in the response under certain situations.

property.description: Location of where the error occurred. Returns the JSON field name or query parameter name of the request. Not included in the response under certain situations.

CreateAudienceGroupRequest.description: Create audience for uploading user IDs (by JSON)

description.description:
The audience's name. This is case-insensitive, meaning AUDIENCE and audience are considered identical.
Max character limit: 120

isIfaAudience.description:
To specify recipients by IFAs: set true.
To specify recipients by user IDs: set false or omit isIfaAudience property.

uploadDescription.description: The description to register for the job (in jobs[].description).

audiences.description:
An array of user IDs or IFAs.
Max number: 10,000

id.description: A user ID or IFA. You can specify an empty array.

CreateAudienceGroupResponse.description: Create audience for uploading user IDs (by JSON)

createRoute.description:
How the audience was created.

`MESSAGING_API`: An audience created with Messaging API.

created.description: When the audience was created (in UNIX time).

permission.description:
Audience's update permission. Audiences linked to the same channel will be READ_WRITE.

`READ`: Can use only.
`READ_WRITE`: Can use and update.

expireTimestamp.description: Time of audience expiration. Only returned for specific audiences.

isIfaAudience.description:
The value indicating the type of account to be sent, as specified when creating the audience for uploading user IDs. One of:

`true`: Accounts are specified with IFAs.
`false` (default): Accounts are specified with user IDs.

AddAudienceToAudienceGroupRequest.description: Add user IDs or Identifiers for Advertisers (IFAs) to an audience for uploading user IDs (by JSON)

audiences.description: An array of up to 10,000 user IDs or IFAs.

description.description:
The audience's name. This is case-insensitive, meaning AUDIENCE and audience are considered identical.
Max character limit: 120

requestId.description:
The request ID of a broadcast or narrowcast message sent in the past 60 days.
Each Messaging API request has a request ID.

clickUrl.description:
The URL clicked by the user. If empty, users who clicked any URL in the message are added to the list of recipients.
Max character limit: 2,000

created.description: When the audience was created (in UNIX time).

requestId.description: The request ID that was specified when the audience was created.

clickUrl.description: The URL that was specified when the audience was created.

createRoute.description:
How the audience was created.
`MESSAGING_API`: An audience created with Messaging API.

permission.description:
Audience's update permission. Audiences linked to the same channel will be READ_WRITE.

- `READ`: Can use only.
- `READ_WRITE`: Can use and update.

expireTimestamp.description: Time of audience expiration. Only returned for specific audiences.

isIfaAudience.description:
The value indicating the type of account to be sent, as specified when creating the audience for uploading user IDs. One of:

true: Accounts are specified with IFAs.
false (default): Accounts are specified with user IDs.

description.description:
The audience's name.
This is case-insensitive, meaning `AUDIENCE` and `audience` are considered identical.
Max character limit: 120

requestId.description:
The request ID of a broadcast or narrowcast message sent in the past 60 days.
Each Messaging API request has a request ID.

created.description: When the audience was created (in UNIX time).

requestId.description: The request ID that was specified when the audience was created.

description.description:
The audience's name. This is case-insensitive, meaning AUDIENCE and audience are considered identical.
Max character limit: 120

jobs.description:
An array of jobs.
This array is used to keep track of each attempt to add new user IDs or IFAs to an audience for uploading user IDs.
Empty array is returned for any other type of audience.
Max: 50

audienceCount.description: The number of users included in the audience.

created.description: When the audience was created (in UNIX time).

requestId.description:
The request ID that was specified when the audience was created.
This is only included when `audienceGroup.type` is CLICK or IMP.

clickUrl.description:
The URL that was specified when the audience was created.
This is only included when `audienceGroup.type` is CLICK and link URL is specified.

isIfaAudience.description: The value indicating the type of account to be sent, as specified when creating the audience for uploading user IDs.

audienceCount.description: The number of accounts (recipients) that were added or removed.

created.description: When the job was created (in UNIX time).

AudienceGroupCreateRoute.description:
How the audience was created. One of:

- `OA_MANAGER`: Audience created with [LINE Official Account Manager](https://manager.line.biz/).
- `MESSAGING_API`: Audience created with Messaging API.
- `POINT_AD`: Audience created with [LINE Points Ads](https://www.linebiz.com/jp/service/line-point-ad/) (Japanese only).
- `AD_MANAGER`: Audience created with [LINE Ads](https://admanager.line.biz/).

GetAudienceGroupsResponse.description: Gets data for more than one audience.

audienceGroups.description: An array of audience data. If there are no audiences that match the specified filter, an empty array will be returned.

hasNextPage.description: true when this is not the last page.

totalCount.description: The total number of audiences that can be returned with the specified filter.

readWriteAudienceGroupTotalCount.description: Of the audiences you can get with the specified filter, the number of audiences with the update permission set to READ_WRITE.

size.description: The maximum number of audiences on the current page.

GetAudienceGroupAuthorityLevelResponse.description: Get the authority level of the audience

UpdateAudienceGroupAuthorityLevelRequest.description: Change the authority level of the audience

available.description: true if friend demographic information is available.

broadcast.description: Number of messages sent to all of this LINE Official Account's friends (broadcast messages).

targeting.description: Number of messages sent to some of this LINE Official Account's friends, based on specific attributes (targeted messages).

chat.description: Number of messages sent from LINE Official Account Manager [Chat screen](https://www.linebiz.com/jp/manual/OfficialAccountManager/chats/) (only available in Japanese).

apiBroadcast.description: Number of broadcast messages sent with the `Send broadcast message` Messaging API operation.

apiPush.description: Number of push messages sent with the `Send push message` Messaging API operation.

apiMulticast.description: Number of multicast messages sent with the `Send multicast message` Messaging API operation.

apiNarrowcast.description: Number of narrowcast messages sent with the `Send narrowcast message` Messaging API operation.

apiReply.description: Number of replies sent with the `Send reply message` Messaging API operation.

followers.description:
The number of times, as of the specified date, that a user added this LINE Official Account as a friend for the first time.
The number doesn't decrease even if a user later blocks the account or when they delete their LINE account.

targetedReaches.description:
The number of users, as of the specified date, that the LINE Official Account can reach through targeted messages based on gender, age, and/or region.
This number only includes users who are active on LINE or LINE services and whose demographics have a high level of certainty.

blocks.description:
The number of users blocking the account as of the specified date.
The number decreases when a user unblocks the account.

GetMessageEventResponse.description: Statistics about how users interact with narrowcast messages or broadcast messages sent from your LINE Official Account.

messages.description: Array of information about individual message bubbles.

clicks.description: Array of information about opened URLs in the message.

timestamp.description: UNIX timestamp for message delivery time in seconds.

delivered.description:
Number of messages delivered.
This property shows values of less than 20.
However, if all messages have not been sent, it will be null.

uniqueImpression.description: Number of users who opened the message, meaning they displayed at least 1 bubble.

uniqueClick.description: Number of users who opened any URL in the message.

uniqueMediaPlayed.description: Number of users who started playing any video or audio in the message.

uniqueMediaPlayed100Percent.description: Number of users who played the entirety of any video or audio in the message.

impression.description: Number of times the bubble was displayed.

mediaPlayed.description: Number of times audio or video in the bubble started playing.

mediaPlayed25Percent.description: Number of times audio or video in the bubble started playing and was played 25% of the total time.

mediaPlayed50Percent.description: Number of times audio or video in the bubble started playing and was played 50% of the total time.

mediaPlayed75Percent.description: Number of times audio or video in the bubble started playing and was played 75% of the total time.

mediaPlayed100Percent.description: Number of times audio or video in the bubble started playing and was played 100% of the total time.

uniqueMediaPlayed.description: Number of users that started playing audio or video in the bubble.

uniqueMediaPlayed25Percent.description: Number of users that started playing audio or video in the bubble and played 25% of the total time.

uniqueMediaPlayed50Percent.description: Number of users that started playing audio or video in the bubble and played 50% of the total time.

uniqueMediaPlayed75Percent.description: Number of users that started playing audio or video in the bubble and played 75% of the total time.

uniqueMediaPlayed100Percent.description: Number of users that started playing audio or video in the bubble and played 100% of the total time.

click.description: Number of times the URL was opened.

uniqueClick.description: Number of users that opened the URL.

uniqueClickOfRequest.description: Number of users who opened this url through any link in the message. If a message contains two links to the same URL and a user opens both links, they're counted only once.

GetStatisticsPerUnitResponse.description: Response object for `get statistics per unit`

messages.description: Array of information about individual message bubbles.

clicks.description: Array of information about opened URLs in the message.

uniqueImpression.description: Number of users who opened the message, meaning they displayed at least 1 bubble.

uniqueClick.description: Number of users who opened any URL in the message.

uniqueMediaPlayed.description: Number of users who started playing any video or audio in the message.

uniqueMediaPlayed100Percent.description: Number of users who played the entirety of any video or audio in the message.

impression.description: Number of times the bubble was displayed.

mediaPlayed.description: Number of times audio or video in the bubble started playing.

mediaPlayed25Percent.description: Number of times audio or video in the bubble started playing and was played 25% of the total time.

mediaPlayed50Percent.description: Number of times audio or video in the bubble started playing and was played 50% of the total time.

mediaPlayed75Percent.description: Number of times audio or video in the bubble started playing and was played 75% of the total time.

mediaPlayed100Percent.description: Number of times audio or video in the bubble started playing and was played 100% of the total time.

uniqueImpression.description: Number of users the bubble was displayed.

uniqueMediaPlayed.description: Number of users that started playing audio or video in the bubble.

uniqueMediaPlayed25Percent.description: Number of users that started playing audio or video in the bubble and played 25% of the total time.

uniqueMediaPlayed50Percent.description: Number of users that started playing audio or video in the bubble and played 50% of the total time.

uniqueMediaPlayed75Percent.description: Number of users that started playing audio or video in the bubble and played 75% of the total time.

uniqueMediaPlayed100Percent.description: Number of users that started playing audio or video in the bubble and played 100% of the total time.

click.description: Number of times the URL in the bubble was opened.

uniqueClick.description: Number of users that opened the URL in the bubble.

uniqueClickOfRequest.description:
Number of users who opened this url through any link in the message.
If another message bubble contains the same URL and a user opens both links, it's counted only once.

CallbackRequest.description: The request body contains a JSON object with the user ID of a bot that should receive webhook events and an array of webhook event objects.

destination.description:
User ID of a bot that should receive webhook events.
The user ID value is a string that matches the regular expression, `U[0-9a-f]{32}`.

events.description:
Array of webhook event objects.
The LINE Platform may send an empty array that doesn't include a webhook event object to confirm communication.

timestamp.description: Time of the event in milliseconds.

webhookEventId.description: Webhook Event ID. An ID that uniquely identifies a webhook event. This is a string in ULID format.

isRedelivery.description: Whether the webhook event is a redelivered one or not.

groupId.description: Group ID of the source group chat

userId.description: ID of the source user. Only included in message events. Only users of LINE for iOS and LINE for Android are included in userId.
ID of the source user. Only included in message events. Only users of LINE for iOS and LINE for Android are included in userId.

roomId.description: Room ID of the source multi-person chat

MessageEvent.description: Webhook event object which contains the sent message.

originalContentUrl.description: URL of the image file. Only included when contentProvider.type is external.

previewImageUrl.description: URL of the preview image. Only included when contentProvider.type is external.

emojis.description: Array of one or more LINE emoji objects. Only included in the message event when the text property contains a LINE emoji.

quoteToken.description: Quote token to quote this message.

quotedMessageId.description: Message ID of a quoted message. Only included when the received message quotes a past message.

mentionees.description: Array of one or more mention objects. Max: 20 mentions

index.description: Index position of the user mention for a character in text, with the first character being at position 0.

length.description: The length of the text of the mentioned user. For a mention @example, 8 is the length.

userId.description: User ID of the mentioned user. Only included if mention.mentions[].type is user and the user consents to the LINE Official Account obtaining their user profile information.

isSelf.description: Whether the mentioned user is the bot that receives the webhook.

quoteToken.description: Quote token to quote this message.

id.description: Image set ID. Only included when multiple images are sent simultaneously.

index.description: An index starting from 1, indicating the image number in a set of images sent simultaneously. Only included when multiple images are sent simultaneously. However, it won't be included if the sender is using LINE 11.15 or earlier for Android.

total.description: The total number of images sent simultaneously.

allOf.description: Message object which contains the video content sent from the source. The preview image is displayed in the chat and the video is played when the image is tapped.

quoteToken.description: Quote token to quote this message.

allOf.description: Message object which contains the audio content sent from the source.
Message object which contains the file sent from the source.
Message object which contains the location data sent from the source.
Message object which contains the sticker data sent from the source.

keywords.description:
Array of up to 15 keywords describing the sticker.
If a sticker has 16 or more keywords, a random selection of 15 keywords will be returned.
The keyword selection is random for each event, so different keywords may be returned for the same sticker.

text.description:
Any text entered by the user. This property is only included for message stickers.
Max character limit: 100

quoteToken.description: Quote token to quote this message.

quotedMessageId.description: Message ID of a quoted message. Only included when the received message quotes a past message.

UnsendEvent.description: Event object for when the user unsends a message.

messageId.description: The message ID of the unsent message

replyToken.description: Reply token used to send reply message to this event

FollowEvent.description: Event object for when your LINE Official Account is added as a friend (or unblocked). You can reply to follow events.

isUnblocked.description: Whether a user has added your LINE Official Account as a friend or unblocked.

UnfollowEvent.description: Event object for when your LINE Official Account is blocked.

replyToken.description: Reply token used to send reply message to this event

JoinEvent.description: Event object for when your LINE Official Account joins a group chat or multi-person chat. You can reply to join events.

LeaveEvent.description: Event object for when a user removes your LINE Official Account from a group chat or when your LINE Official Account leaves a group chat or multi-person chat.

replyToken.description: Reply token used to send reply message to this event

MemberJoinedEvent.description: Event object for when a user joins a group chat or multi-person chat that the LINE Official Account is in.

members.description: Users who joined. Array of source user objects.

MemberLeftEvent.description: Event object for when a user leaves a group chat or multi-person chat that the LINE Official Account is in.

members.description: Users who left. Array of source user objects.

replyToken.description: Reply token used to send reply message to this event

PostbackEvent.description: Event object for when a user performs a postback action which initiates a postback. You can reply to postback events.

replyToken.description: Reply token used to send reply message to this event

VideoPlayCompleteEvent.description: Event for when a user finishes viewing a video at least once with the specified trackingId sent by the LINE Official Account.

trackingId.description: ID used to identify a video. Returns the same value as the trackingId assigned to the video message.

replyToken.description: Reply token used to send reply message to this event

BeaconEvent.description: Event object for when a user enters the range of a LINE Beacon. You can reply to beacon events.

hwid.description: Hardware ID of the beacon that was detected

dm.description: Device message of beacon that was detected.

replyToken.description: Reply token used to send reply message to this event. This property won't be included if linking the account has failed.

AccountLinkEvent.description: Event object for when a user has linked their LINE account with a provider's service account. You can reply to account link events.

LinkContent.description: Content of the account link event.

result.description: One of the following values to indicate whether linking the account was successful or not

nonce.description: Specified nonce (number used once) when verifying the user ID.

replyToken.description: Reply token used to send reply message to this event

ThingsEvent.description: Indicates that a user linked a device with LINE.

allOf.description: Indicates that a user linked a device with LINE.

deviceId.description: Device ID of the device that has been linked with LINE.

allOf.description: Indicates that the user unlinked a device from LINE.

deviceId.description: Device ID of the device that has been linked with LINE.

allOf.description: This event indicates that an automatic communication scenario has been executed.

deviceId.description: Device ID of the device that has been linked with LINE.

revision.description: Revision number of the scenario set containing the executed scenario

startTime.description: Timestamp for when execution of scenario action started (milliseconds, LINE app time)

endTime.description: Timestamp for when execution of scenario was completed (milliseconds, LINE app time)

actionResults.description: Execution result of individual operations specified in action. Only included when things.result.resultCode is success.

ModuleEvent.description: This event indicates that the module channel has been attached to the LINE Official Account. Sent to the webhook URL server of the module channel.

botId.description: User ID of the bot on the attached LINE Official Account

scopes.description: An array of strings indicating the scope permitted by the admin of the LINE Official Account.

botId.description: Detached LINE Official Account bot user ID

ActivatedEvent.description: This event indicates that the module channel has been switched to Active Channel by calling the Acquire Control API. Sent to the webhook URL server of the module channel.

DeactivatedEvent.description: This event indicates that the module channel has been switched to Standby Channel by calling Acquire Control API or Release Control API. Sent to the webhook URL server of the module channel.

BotSuspendedEvent.description: This event indicates that the LINE Official Account has been suspended (Suspend). Sent to the webhook URL server of the module channel.

BotResumedEvent.description: This event indicates that the LINE Official Account has returned from the suspended state. Sent to the webhook URL server of the module channel.

PnpDeliveryCompletionEvent.description: When a request is made to the LINE notification messages API and delivery of the LINE notification message to the user is completed, a dedicated webhook event (delivery completion event) is sent from the LINE Platform to the webhook URL of the bot server.

PnpDelivery.description: A delivery object containing a hashed phone number string or a string specified by `X-Line-Delivery-Tag` header

data.description: A hashed phone number string or a string specified by `X-Line-Delivery-Tag` header

DetachModuleRequest.description: Unlink (detach) the module channel by the operation of the module channel administrator

botId.description: User ID of the LINE Official Account bot attached to the module channel.

AcquireChatControlRequest.description: Request entity of the Acquire Control API

expired.description:
`True`: After the time limit (ttl) has passed, the initiative (Chat Control) will return to the Primary Channel. (Default)
`False`: There's no time limit and the initiative (Chat Control) doesn't change over time.

ttl.description:
The time it takes for initiative (Chat Control) to return to the Primary Channel (the time that the module channel stays on the Active Channel).
The value is specified in seconds. The maximum value is one year (3600 * 24 * 365).
The default value is 3600 (1 hour).

* Ignored if the value of expired is false.

GetModulesResponse.description: List of bots to which the module is attached

bots.description: Array of Bot list Item objects representing basic information about the bot.

next.description:
Continuation token.
Used to get the next array of basic bot information.
This property is only returned if there are more unreturned results.

premiumId.description: Bot's premium ID. Not included in the response if the premium ID isn't set.

pictureUrl.description: Profile image URL. Image URL starting with `https://`. Not included in the response if the bot doesn't have a profile image.

description.description:
Name of the LIFF app.

The LIFF app name can't include "LINE" or similar strings, or inappropriate strings.

permanentLinkPattern.description: How additional information in LIFF URLs is handled. Specify `concat`.

LiffBotPrompt.description:
Specify the setting for bot link feature with one of the following values:

`normal`: Display the option to add the LINE Official Account as a friend in the channel consent screen.
`aggressive`: Display a screen with the option to add the LINE Official Account as a friend after the channel consent screen.
`none`: Don't display the option to add the LINE Official Account as a friend.
  The default value is none.

type.description:
Size of the LIFF app view. Specify one of these values:
- compact
- tall
- full

url.description:
Endpoint URL. This is the URL of the web app that implements the LIFF app
(e.g. https://example.com).
Used when the LIFF app is launched using the LIFF URL.
The URL scheme must be https. URL fragments (#URL-fragment) can't be specified.

moduleMode.description:
`true` to use the LIFF app in modular mode.
When in modular mode, the action button in the header is not displayed.

type.description:
Size of the LIFF app view. Specify one of these values:
- compact
- tall
- full

url.description:
Endpoint URL. This is the URL of the web app that implements the LIFF app
(e.g. https://example.com).
Used when the LIFF app is launched using the LIFF URL.
The URL scheme must be https. URL fragments (#URL-fragment) can't be specified.

moduleMode.description:
`true` to use the LIFF app in modular mode.
When in modular mode, the action button in the header is not displayed.

ble.description: `true` if the LIFF app supports Bluetooth Low Energy for LINE Things. `false` otherwise.

qrCode.description: `true` to use the 2D code reader in the LIFF app. false otherwise. The default value is `false`.

description.description:
Name of the LIFF app.

The LIFF app name can't include "LINE" or similar strings, or inappropriate strings.

permanentLinkPattern.description: How additional information in LIFF URLs is handled. Specify `concat`.

LiffScope.description:
Array of scopes required for some LIFF SDK methods to function.
The default value is `["profile", "chat_message.write"]`.

permanentLinkPattern.description: How additional information in LIFF URLs is handled. concat is returned.

AttachModuleResponse.description: Attach by operation of the module channel provider

bot_id.description: User ID of the bot on the LINE Official Account.

scopes.description: Permissions (scope) granted by the LINE Official Account admin.

productId.description: Package ID for a set of stickers

IssueStatelessChannelTokenByJWTAssertion.description: Request body to issue a new token with JWT assertion

client_assertion.description: A JSON Web Token the client needs to create and sign with the private key of the Assertion Signing Key.

IssueStatelessChannelTokenByClientSecret.description: Request body to issue a new token with `client_id` and `client_secret`

access_token.description:
A stateless channel access token.
The token is an opaque string which means its format is an implementation detail
and the consumer of this token should never try to use the data parsed from the token.

expires_in.description: Duration in seconds after which the issued access token expires

token_type.description: Token type. The value is always `Bearer`.

kids.description: Array of channel access token key IDs.

access_token.description:
A short-lived channel access token. Valid for 30 days.
Note: Channel access tokens cannot be refreshed.

expires_in.description: Time until channel access token expires in seconds from time the token is issued.

token_type.description: Token type. The value is always `Bearer`.

expires_in.description: Amount of time in seconds from issue to expiration of the channel access token

key_id.description: Unique key ID for identifying the channel access token.

client_id.description: The channel ID for which the channel access token was issued.

expires_in.description: Number of seconds before the channel access token expires.

scope.description: Permissions granted to the channel access token.

uploadDescription.description: The description to register with the job

file.description:
A text file with one user ID or IFA entered per line. Specify text/plain as Content-Type. Max file number: 1
Max number: 1,500,000

description.description:
The audience's name. This is case-insensitive, meaning AUDIENCE and audience are considered identical.
Max character limit: 120

isIfaAudience.description:
To specify recipients by IFAs: set `true`.
To specify recipients by user IDs: set `false` or omit isIfaAudience property.

uploadDescription.description: The description to register for the job (in `jobs[].description`).

file.description:
A text file with one user ID or IFA entered per line. Specify text/plain as Content-Type. Max file number: 1
Max number: 1,500,000

code.description: Authorization code received from the LINE Platform.

redirect_uri.description: Specify the redirect_uri specified in the URL for authentication and authorization.

code_verifier.description: Specify when using PKCE (Proof Key for Code Exchange) defined in the OAuth 2.0 extension specification as a countermeasure against authorization code interception attacks.

client_id.description:
Instead of using Authorization header, you can use this parameter to specify the channel ID of the module channel.
You can find the channel ID of the module channel in the LINE Developers Console.

client_secret.description:
Instead of using Authorization header, you can use this parameter to specify the channel secret of the module channel.
You can find the channel secret of the module channel in the LINE Developers Console.

region.description: If you specified a value for region in the URL for authentication and authorization, specify the same value.

basic_search_id.description: If you specified a value for basic_search_id in the URL for authentication and authorization, specify the same value.

scope.description: If you specified a value for scope in the URL for authentication and authorization, specify the same value.

brand_type.description: If you specified a value for brand_type in the URL for authentication and authorization, specify the same value.

client_assertion.description: A JSON Web Token the client needs to create and sign with the private key of the Assertion Signing Key.

access_token.description: A short-lived or long-lived channel access token.
